source_caption_data.pre_caption: This video presents a countryside scenery shot, focusing on the atmosphere of a quiet, rural setting rather than a specific subject. The view begins from a wet, flagstone patio, looking out over a vibrant green lawn towards a wooden-fenced pasture where two brown horses graze among yellow wildflowers under a cloudy sky. The camera then gently tilts down, shifting the focus from the pastoral landscape to the detailed, irregular pattern of the damp, weathered stones of the patio itself. The absence of a main subject allows the viewer to absorb the tranquil environment and the textures of the natural and man-made elements within it.

The description of "two brown horses" is too general; in the video, one horse is a light chestnut with a white sock on its rear left leg, while the other is a much darker bay horse. The caption also misses that the chestnut horse is standing still and looking towards the right, while only the bay horse is actively grazing. The phrase "noticeably shakes" is vague; the camera movement is a distinct, sharp jolt downwards, as if dropped, not a gentle wobble. The final sentence, which explains the effect on the viewer and the absence of a main subject, is subjective and interpretive, violating the instruction to describe only what is visible. The horses are clearly the main subjects of the first segment, and the caption is contradictory by stating there is no subject. A better approach would be to describe the horses as the initial subjects and the patio stones as the subject of the second segment. Finally, the description of the "damp, weathered stones" could be enhanced by noting their specific color, which is a mix of dark slate grey and earthy brown, with small tufts of bright green moss growing in the crevices between them.
